info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 9:25AM CDT until June 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County.
For the Fourche Lafave River...including Houston, Gravelly...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Fourche Lafave River near Houston.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 930 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
